en: Interview with Tommy Smith, volunteer with Samaritan's Purse, conducted by Casey Kaufman. Smith details his personal experiences volunteering with the organization in Gatlinburg and the families that he encountered. Conducted over Zoom due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This is a representative quote from the interview: "You get to his driveway, and it's these big, gray boulders, you have to go around the curb to see a beautiful log cabin made out of chestnut logs. He's bracing himself and he turns the corner and it's nothing but a slab and smoldering ashes."

Interview with Tommy Smith, volunteer with Samaritan's Purse, conducted by Casey Kaufman. He's bracing himself and he turns the corner and it's nothing but a slab and smoldering ashes."

none: Accompanying canvas for Interview with Tommy Smith, 2020-06-19

en: Would you state your name and tell us about your background?
Can you tell us about what drove you to begin working with Samaritan's Purse? Can you tell us about Samaritan's Purse?
What was the experience of receiving the call to go to Gatlinburg like?
So you were already following what was happening on the news before receiving a call?
After getting to Gatlinburg, what transpired? What does the Samaritan's Purse operation look like? How does it take shape?
You were stationed at the First Baptist Church in Gatlinburg? What was it like when you arrived a week after the fire?
Can you tell us about the experiences you had at the sites of homeowners where you were sifting through ashes?
Was this the first wildfire that you assisted on with Samaritan's Purse?
Are there any other specific memories from meeting with these homeowners?
What kind of impact did this deployment have on you emotionally or spiritually?
Have you gone back to Gatlinburg since the deployment?
After going back, does it seem like the community is recovering from the event?
Is there anything else that we haven't discussed that you would like to?

seo.title: Interview with Tommy Smith, 2020-06-19 - Rising From the Ashes Oral Histories
seo.description: Interview with Tommy Smith, volunteer with Samaritan's Purse, conducted by Casey Kaufman. This is a representative quote from the interview: "You get to his driveway, and it's these big, gray boulders, you have to go around the curb to see a beautiful log cabin made out of chestnut logs. He's bracing himself and he turns the corner and it's nothing but a slab and smoldering ashes."
